page.title: 06CUSTOMS IN MARSDEN
page.content: { { In September there is a festival in Marsden.There are a lot of stalls with things to buy and games to play.These are usually on Wessen court by the old people's flats if the weather is fine, and they are in the mill canteen at the bottom of Fall Lane if it is wet. There is a procession with a rush cart and the White Rose dancers.They do morris dancing and have red ,white and black costumes.There is a carnival queen and she rides in an old car or in a horse and cart.In the Conservative club they serve refreshments and the fancy dress competition is down at the youth club at Lake Side. There is a rush cart and a bouncy castle.You can go up the church tower to the top. {Richard Haigh -June 1985
